intro: Guettardella erythrocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited strobilanthes, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its striking red berries that remain on the plant for an extended period, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
